name: 02. "VESPA 1955"
description:
2/4 from "Side-B" collection.
After the Vespa “Sei giorni”, sold in limited series, this is the first Vespa with sports characteristics produced in large series. 

The 150 GS is a milestone in the history of the scooter, not just the Vespa. 
It will be remembered as the most beautiful scooter ever made in the world, currently in great demand on the vintage Vespa market. 
In the mid-50s, the scooter audience has grown, it has changed. 
The Vespa becomes the means with which it stands out in a society that, tiredly, becomes aware of a new social subject: young people.

For the first time, a vehicle born with a "quiet" character, to motorize large groups of users, shows itself capable of "impressive" performance. 
The Vespa 150 GS has a very prominent sporting focus, derived from the experience of the Piaggio racing team in competitions. 
The engine has direct admission in the cylinder and produces 8 hp at 7500 rpm, the gearbox has four gears, the elongated seat and the large wheels substantially modify the Vespa line that proves to be a dynamic vehicle.

The model exhibited at the Piaggio Museum is a pre-series.

This authentic relic is found somewhere in Mallorca.
